intro: Nothopanax multijugus, commonly known as the multijugus sycamore, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with multiple leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by spherical fruits containing seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
